OpenSim.Region.Framework.Scenes.SceneGraph Class Reference

This class used to be called InnerScene and may not yet truly be a SceneGraph. The non scene graph components should be migrated out over time. More...

Inheritance diagram for OpenSim.Region.Framework.Scenes.SceneGraph:

List< IScenePresence > GetScenePresences ()
 Get a reference to the scene presence list. Changes to the list will be done in a copy There is no guarantee that presences will remain in the scene after the list is returned. This list should remain private to SceneGraph. Callers wishing to iterate should instead pass a delegate to ForEachScenePresence.

 THIS IS TO ONLY BE CALLED WHEN AN OBJECT UUID IS UPDATED!!! This method is HIGHLY unsafe and destroys the integrity of the checks above! This is NOT to be used lightly! Do NOT use this unless you have to!

PhysicsScene PhysicsScene [get, set]

Detailed Description

This class used to be called InnerScene and may not yet truly be a SceneGraph. The non scene graph components should be migrated out over time.

void OpenSim.Region.Framework.Scenes.SceneGraph.doObjectDuplicateOnRay ( uint  localID,
uint  dupeFlags,
UUID  AgentID,
UUID  GroupID,
UUID  RayTargetObj,
Vector3  RayEnd,
Vector3  RayStart,
bool  BypassRaycast,
bool  RayEndIsIntersection,
bool  CopyCenters,
bool  CopyRotates 
)

Duplicates object specified by localID at position raycasted against RayTargetObject using RayEnd and RayStart to determine what the angle of the ray is.

Parameters:
localID ID of object to duplicate
dupeFlags 
AgentID Agent doing the duplication
GroupID Group of new object
RayTargetObj The target of the Ray
RayEnd The ending of the ray (farthest away point)
RayStart The Beginning of the ray (closest point)
BypassRaycast Bool to bypass raycasting
RayEndIsIntersection The End specified is the place to add the object
CopyCenters Position the object at the center of the face that it's colliding with
CopyRotates Rotate the object the same as the localID object
ISceneEntity OpenSim.Region.Framework.Scenes.SceneGraph.DuplicateEntity ( ISceneEntity  entity  )

UUID  GroupID,

)

Parameters:

offset Duplicated objects position offset from the original entity
flags Flags to give the Duplicated object
AgentID 
GroupID 
rot Rotation to have the duplicated entity set to

Performs action on all scene presences. This can ultimately run the actions in parallel but any delegates passed in will need to implement their own locking on data they reference and modify outside of the scope of the delegate.

List<IScenePresence> OpenSim.Region.Framework.Scenes.SceneGraph.GetScenePresences (  ) 

Get a reference to the scene presence list. Changes to the list will be done in a copy There is no guarantee that presences will remain in the scene after the list is returned. This list should remain private to SceneGraph. Callers wishing to iterate should instead pass a delegate to ForEachScenePresence.

Returns:

THIS IS TO ONLY BE CALLED WHEN AN OBJECT UUID IS UPDATED!!! This method is HIGHLY unsafe and destroys the integrity of the checks above! This is NOT to be used lightly! Do NOT use this unless you have to!

internal void OpenSim.Region.Framework.Scenes.SceneGraph.UpdatePrimTexture ( uint  LocalID,
byte[]  texture,
IClientAPI  remoteClient 
) [protected]

Update the texture entry of the given prim.

A texture entry is an object that contains details of all the textures of the prim's face. In this case, the texture is given in its byte serialized form.

Parameters:
LocalID 
texture 
remoteClient

Dictionary<PCode, IEntityCreator> OpenSim.Region.Framework.Scenes.SceneGraph.m_entityCreators = new Dictionary<PCode, IEntityCreator>() [protected]

Registered classes that are capable of creating entities.

uint OpenSim.Region.Framework.Scenes.SceneGraph.m_lastAllocatedLocalId = 720000 [protected]

The last allocated local prim id. When a new local id is requested, the next number in the sequence is dispensed.
